channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ドバイを拠点とするCamb.aiは、100以上の言語の音声を「瞬時に」ダビングする翻訳ツールを製造しており、全豪オープンでも使用された。
item.description:
Melanie Goodfellow / Deadline:
Dubai-based Camb.ai, which makes a translation tool that “instantaneously” dubs speech in 100+ languages and was used at the Australian Open, raised a $4M seed  —  Dubbing Platform Camb.ai, which has recently been used for coverage of the 2024 Australian Open tennis tournament …

item.title: フォックス、ESPN、WBDの3社が、2024年秋に米国でスポーツ・ストリーミング・サービスを開始する合弁会社を設立すると発表。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Fox, ESPN, and WBD announce a new joint venture to launch a streaming sports service in the US in the fall of 2024; each entity will own a third of the JV  —  The service will be available to ESPN+, Hulu and Max subscribers.

item.title: スナップ、第4四半期の売上高は前年同期比5%増の$13.6億ドル（予想$13.8億ドル）、DAUは前年同期比10%増の41.4万人、純損失は$2.48億ドル（同$2.88億ドル）、SNAPは時間外で30%以上下落（Jonathan Vanian/CNBC
item.description:
Jonathan Vanian / CNBC:
Snap reports Q4 revenue up 5% YoY to $1.36B, vs. $1.38B est., DAUs up 10% YoY to 414M, a net loss of $248M, vs. $288M YoY; SNAP drops 30%+ after hours  —  - Snap said fourth-quarter revenue rose about 5%, while the company's net loss narrowed 14% from a year earlier.

item.title: 物議を醸したソーシャルメディアへの投稿が原因で『マンダロリアン』を解雇されたジーナ・カラーノが、Xの資金提供による訴訟で不当解雇としてディズニーとルーカスフィルムを訴える（Winston Cho/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Winston Cho / The Hollywood Reporter:
Gina Carano, who was fired from The Mandalorian after controversial social media posts, sues Disney and Lucasfilm for wrongful termination in a suit funded by X  —  The actress claims the entertainment giant discriminated against her for voicing right-wing opinions on hot-button issues.

item.title: フォックスの元司会者タッカー・カールソンは、プーチンにインタビューするためにモスクワに行き、自身のウェブサイトとXで「編集なし」のインタビューを放送すると語った（Dave Lawler/Axios）
item.description:
Dave Lawler / Axios:
Former Fox host Tucker Carlson says he has traveled to Moscow to interview Vladimir Putin and will air the interview “unedited” on his website and on X  —  Former Fox News host Tucker Carlson said in a video posted to X on Tuesday that he is in Moscow to interview Russian President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: ビデオゲーム販売会社IGNの編集・クリエイティブ部門の従業員の87％がNewsGuild-CWAとの組合結成に賛成、80人以上の従業員で構成される（Adam Chitwood/The Wrap）
item.description:
Adam Chitwood / The Wrap:
An 87% majority of editorial and creative employees at video game outlet IGN vote to unionize with the NewsGuild-CWA; the group will consist of 80+ employees  —  The newly formed IGN Creators Guild will consist of over 80 employees  —  A majority of editorial and creative employees at IGN …

item.title: 情報筋パックとプーシキンに投資した屋根コングロマリット、スタンダード・インダストリーズが、グレイドン・カーターのエア・メールを〜5000万ドルで買収する交渉中（Liz Hoffman/Semafor）
item.description:
Liz Hoffman / Semafor:
Sources: Standard Industries, a roofing conglomerate that has invested in Puck and Pushkin, is in talks to acquire Graydon Carter's Air Mail for ~$50M  —  The Scoop  —  A billionaire roofing family is in talks to buy Air Mail, former Vanity Fair editor Graydon Carter's effort to drag glossy magazines into the online age.

item.title: YouTubeによると、Shortsの1日の平均再生回数は7000万回以上、Shortsをアップロードするチャンネル数は前年比50％増（Abner Li/9to5Google）
item.description:
Abner Li / 9to5Google:
YouTube says Shorts averages 70B+ daily views and the number of channels uploading Shorts rose 50% YoY  —  YouTube CEO Neal Mohan today shared what the video service is focusing on in 2024.  At a high-level, it's AI, elevating creators, safety, and the “next frontier” of the living room and subscriptions.

item.title: NPRの「創設の母」であり、1971年の開局と同時にNPRに加わり、「All Things Considered」の監督と司会を務めたリンダ・ワートハイマーが53年ぶりに引退する（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
Linda Wertheimer, an NPR “founding mother” who joined the outlet at its 1971 launch and directed and hosted All Things Considered, is retiring after 53 years  —  Linda Wertheimer, one of the “founding mothers” of National Public Radio, said today that she is retiring.

item.title: Substackは、プラットフォーム上のクリエイターが広告を販売するためのパイロットプログラムを実施している。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Substack is running a pilot program to help creators on the platform sell ads; a writer says Substack contracted an outside team to approach advertisers  —  Substack is experimenting with a new pilot program that helps creators on its platform find advertisers and coordinate ad buys, Axios has learned.

item.title: オニオン・ユニオンがG/Oメディアとの暫定契約の批准を決議、G/OメディアによるジェネレーティブAIの使用や賃上げなどの条件を設定（Katie Kilkenny/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / Hollywood Reporter:
The Onion Union votes to ratify the tentative deal with G/O Media, setting terms on G/O Media's use of generative AI, wage increases, and more  —  The new deal contains language governing the use of AI, wage increases and improved financial terms in the event of layoffs.

item.title: Mubiがベネルクスのインディーズ配給会社Cinéartの株式の過半数を取得。
item.description:
Alex Ritman / Variety:
Arthouse streamer Mubi acquires a majority stake in leading Benelux indie distributor Cinéart, marking the first acquisition of a distributor by Mubi  —  Arthouse streamer and distributor Mubi has acquired a majority stake in leading Benelux indie distributor Cinéart …

item.title: YouTubeによると、YouTube TVの登録者数は8M以上となり、2022年半ばの5M以上から増加、YouTubeパートナープログラムでは3M以上のチャンネルが広告収入シェアを受けている（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
YouTube says YouTube TV now has 8M+ subscribers, up from 5M+ in mid-2022, and that the YouTube Partner Program has 3M+ channels receiving ad revenue share  —  CEO Neal Mohan also says more than 3 million channels now receive ad-revenue share, touts 1 billion hours viewed on TV daily

item.title: スポティファイ、第4四半期の広告収入は前年同期比12％増の5億100万ユーロと四半期で最高を記録、ポール・ヴォーゲルCFOは2024年にポッドキャスト部門の売上総利益率がプラスになると予想（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Spotify says Q4 ad-supported revenue grew 12% YoY to €501M, a quarterly high; CFO Paul Vogel expects the podcast segment to reach positive gross margin in 2024  —  Spotify pulled in more than new listeners than it expected for the fourth quarter, as the streamer narrowed its net loss …

item.title: メタ社は、同業他社が利用できるAIコンテンツを識別する基準を提案し、フェイスブック、インスタグラム、スレッドに投稿されたAI画像にラベルを付けることを計画している（Mike Isaac/New York Times）。
item.description:
Mike Isaac / New York Times:
Meta proposes standards to identify AI content that its industry peers could use, and plans to label AI images posted on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads  —  The social network wants to promote standardized labels to help detect artificially created photo, video and audio material across its platforms.
